issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
*TLA:* ABC

h3. Description of requirement
Change screens from XML to compose.


h4. Current State
Designs are built in xml layouts

h4. Expected State
Design to be made in compose as future support is in compose only.

h3. Brief rationale for the change 
Use Jetpack compose instead of XML since it is modern way to create screens and all new samples and components can only be rendered using jetpack compose. 

 
*Why Compose?*
Jetpack Compose is Android’s recommended modern toolkit for building native UI. It simplifies and accelerates UI development on Android. Quickly bring your app to life with less code, powerful tools, and intuitive Kotlin APIs.

*Declarative Syntax*: Compose uses a declarative syntax, where the UI is described in a more natural and readable way. Developers specify what the UI should look like based on the current state, and Compose takes care of updating the UI accordingly.

*Reactivity:* Compose is reactive, meaning that the UI automatically updates when the underlying data changes. This eliminates the need for manual updates and reduces the risk of UI-related bugs.

*Code Conciseness:* With Compose, developers can achieve the same UI with significantly less code compared to XML. This results in a more maintainable and readable codebase.

*Full Kotlin Integration:* Compose is written in Kotlin and seamlessly integrates with the Kotlin programming language. This allows developers to leverage Kotlin's features, such as concise syntax and powerful language features while building UIs.


Few Ref:
https://medium.com/@rushabhprajapati20/jetpack-compose-vs-xml-the-future-of-android-ui-development-fd656b1b7330#:~:text=While%20XML%20has%20been%20a,its%20modern%20capabilities%20and%20efficiency.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.summary: Changes required for CFSI Mobile CP App

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
We have noted the adjustments that the biller CFSI has requested as per the Paymentus - CAR financial draught 06232022. This includes adjustments to the Backend and Mobile SDK configurations.

+*Configuration of the backend*+

o    Bill summary notification options “Send me an email”  are not needed.
o    Allow the user to add an Autopay schedule. The user will be able to select from the following 4 schedule options:

           Fixed bi-weekly_

          _ Fixed monthly_

          _ Fixed semi monthly_ 
          _ Fixed weekly_

*In this the additional frequency is _"semi monthly"_ which is named as _"bimonthly"_ in the system

o Spanish localization to be included in the Mobile CP App

+*Change to be done in the biller SDK*+ 
o    For future dated payments, the max payment date to be allowed is for up to a year from the current date in the future (not in sample screenshot)

*+Check from the XOTP - Additional parameter for SDK+*
o    End Date should be a mandatory field for Autopay set-ups

*+NOT CONFIRMED+*
o    Display the OOB Payment Confirmation functionality as shown in the sample screenshot above

resolution.description: Work has been completed on this issue.
resolution.name: Done

fields.description:
The purpose of iFrame SDK is to keep the best practices at a single place that is iFrame SDK. For the clients which are already using iFrame in their application can make the use of iFrame sdk in their code. It helps in centralising the code at single place for all the payment methods.

The SDK will provide the callbacks regarding the success and decline of payment methods when added.

iFrame approaches for each payment methods are listed below:
||Payment Methods||IOS Best Approach ||IOS Links||Android Best Approach||Android links||
|Credit Card|Webview|As per Paymentus| | |
|Debit Card|Webview|As per Paymentus| | |
|Checking|Webview|As per Paymentus| | |
|Savings|Webview|As per Paymentus | | |
|Business Checking|Webview|As per Paymentus | | |
|Apple Pay|Safari View Controller|[https://developer.apple.com/documentation/apple_pay_on_the_web/]| | |
|Amazon Pay|Safari View Controller|[https://amazonpaylegacyintegrationguide.s3.amazonaws.com/docs/eu/amazon-pay-automatic/webview.html\|http://example.com/]| | |
|Paypal, Paypal Credit |Webview + Popupbridge|[https://github.com/braintree/popup-bridge-ios\|http://example.com/]| | |
|Venmo|Safari View Controller|[https://developer.paypal.com/braintree/docs/guides/venmo/client-side/javascript/v3\|http://example.com/]| | |
| | | | | |

fields.summary: Mobile CP - Tracking and updates for CP apps in accordance with iOS Store regulations

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
*Mobile CP iOS Apps update include below case :*

As per Apple's latest guideline all news apps should have Delete account feature in the app with which user's can delete there app account from the mobile app. We need to implement similar in for all our CP mobile apps. Below are the details shared by Apple to us.

Account deletion within apps
App Store Review [Guideline 5.1.1|https://developer.apple.com/app-store/review/guidelines/#5.1.1] provides people with greater control over their personal data by stating that all apps that allow for account creation must also allow users to initiate deletion of their account from within the app. This requirement was set to apply to all app submissions by January 31, 2022. Due to the complexity of implementing this requirement, we’ve extended the deadline to June 30, 2022 to give you more time.

Final deadline for iOS from apple appstore: June 30, 2022
Final deadline for android google playstore: July 20, 2022

 

*Billers that require updates*

 List of billers that are in progress to push regular app update on iTunes which includes the fix for the guidelines of Apple store.
|*Sr. No*|*TLA*|*App Users*|
|1|ANGA|1389|
|2|BMEC|984|

|4|CJGD|146|
|5|CMKY|90|
|6|CNCW|247|
|7|COA4|417|
|8|CPSI|12069|

|10|ETC|597|
|11|FBEM|8|

|13|HRST|252|

|15|MPS|102|
|16|NAGD|235|
|17|SDKY|2507|
|18|TGAZ|154|
 * Request to release the Fix of New Mobile CP app on PROD (App Store) from UAT that are in progress after having signoff from the biller.
 * Feedback received from the billers on the shared New Mobile CP UAT build for improvement and changes.**

 

*Account Managers* of all the TLA are requested to share the feedback from the billers which include
 # Feedback received from the billers regarding any bug or improvements for the apps that are already live on the App Store.
 # Getting approval to update New Mobile CP app with the fix.

 

*Billers for which we can start the process*
|*Sr. No*|*Month*|*TLA*|
|1|June|NAGD, CPSI, CNCW, CFFC, TGAZ and FBEM|

 

*Billers which require immediate update*

fields.summary: ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) Compliance Bugs

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
These are issues identified by a 3rd party reviewer, Criterion, that need to be fixed to ensure compliance with ADA
----
There are around 25+ screens in the app and following needs to checked for accessibility as per the ticket:
 # All labels should have correct accesibility label for voiceover. Need to check if this supports localization
 # Whenever we move to a new screen, the voiceover should speak the heading automatically. Need to explore on this.
 # Enable input auto-fill suggestions wherever possible
 # Contrast check for non-text content
 # All custom dialogs (list picker for security questions, payment type, etc) should trap focus for accessibility
 # Geryed out tab bar Icons should be darker

Give and take it seems like a 4-5 days of effort for ADA compliance from iOS side as we need to explore Accesibility notifications, Trapping focus for custom dialogs  and check for localization with accesibility in addition to adding labels for every UI element, modify and replace icons and text colors.

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

issuetype.description: Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a big user story that needs to be broken down.
issuetype.name: Epic

fields.description:
The vision of this product is to offer our core payment functionality to developers in an easy to understand software development kit “SDK.” These developers, who are building payment applications or applications that will include payment capabilities, will be able to leverage the Paymentus payment functionality to create great payment experiences for their users and at the same time keeping themselves out of PCI Compliance scope.

The SDK is intended to meet the PCI compliance standards and thus keeping the developers using this Software developer Kit out of PCI scope.

This product will allow a developer to accept payments on their web and mobile applications by offering an easy to be integrated SDK.

+*Scope of work for building a MVP version for android SDK:*+
 # Make a single payment on account (now & future dated)
 # View payment history
 # Payment Method management (view, add, edit, delete)
 # Autopay management (view, add, edit, delete) 
 # Support for Java and Kotlin android apps
 # Ability to void a payment
 # Payment search by payment reference number (PRN)

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open
